summary: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the web interface. This can be exploited by a malicious actor to steal session cookies, or to perform other actions on behalf of the victim. This vulnerability is patched in versions 9.9.5 and 10.5.1.
details: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the web interface. This can be exploited by a malicious actor to steal session cookies, or to perform other actions on behalf of the victim. This vulnerability is patched in versions 9.9.5 and 10.5.1.

summary: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to bypass the authentication mechanism and gain access to the SonarQube instance. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles JWT tokens. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.5.
details: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to bypass the authentication mechanism and gain access to the SonarQube instance. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles JWT tokens. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.5.

summary: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles plugins. An attacker can create a malicious plugin that, when installed, will execute arbitrary code on the server. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.1.
details: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles plugins. An attacker can create a malicious plugin that, when installed, will execute arbitrary code on the server. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.1.

summary: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to access sensitive information. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles the display of project analysis reports. An attacker can create a malicious project that, when analyzed, will cause SonarQube to display sensitive information from other projects. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.
details: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to access sensitive information. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles the display of project analysis reports. An attacker can create a malicious project that, when analyzed, will cause SonarQube to display sensitive information from other projects. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.9.

summary: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles the analysis of large projects. An attacker can create a malicious project that, when analyzed, will cause SonarQube to consume a large amount of memory, leading to a crash. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.7.1.
details: A vulnerability in SonarQube allows an attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a flaw in the way SonarQube handles the analysis of large projects. An attacker can create a malicious project that, when analyzed, will cause SonarQube to consume a large amount of memory, leading to a crash. This vulnerability is patched in version 9.7.1.
